reasoning: Well-defined pediatric condition with documented epidemiology. Reporting both incidence (~250 per 100k children per year for new cases) and prevalence (~12% of children globally at any point). Primary metric is prevalence due to chronic/recurrent nature of OME in children.
source: Teele DW et al. (1989). Epidemiology of otitis media during the first seven years of life in children in Greater Boston: A prospective, cohort study. J Infect Dis. 160(1):83-94; WHO Global Burden of Disease 2005
